```{r setup, include=FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
library(here)
library(janitor)
library(lubridate)

knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)

"%!in%" <- Negate("%in%")

#coral data
coral_1 <- read_csv(here("data", "coral_data", "perc_cover_long.csv")) %>% 
  clean_names() %>% 
  mutate(tax = taxonomy_substrate_functional_group) %>% 
  select( - taxonomy_substrate_functional_group) %>% 
  filter(tax %!in% c("Sand", "Turf", "Macroalgae", "Crustose Coralline Algae / Bare Space")) %>%
  mutate(case_when(
    tax == "Fungiidae unidentified" ~ "Unknown Fungiidae")) %>% 
  mutate(date = ym(date)) %>%
    separate(col = date,
             into = c("year", "month"),
             sep = "-",
             extra = "merge",
             remove = TRUE) %>%
  mutate(year = as.character(year))

#export coral data
write.csv(coral_1,"coral.csv", row.names = FALSE)

#coral percent cover
coral_cov_mean_1 <- coral %>% 
 select(year, site:tax) %>% 
  group_by(year, site) %>% 
  summarize(percent_cover_mean = sum(percent_cover)/120) %>% 
  filter(year != "2854")

#export coral percent cover
write.csv(coral_cov_mean_1,"coral_cover.csv", row.names = FALSE)

#coral species percent
coral_spp <- coral %>% 
  select(year, site:tax) %>% 
  group_by(year, site, tax) %>% 
  summarize(percent_cover_mean = sum(percent_cover)/120) %>% 
  filter(year != "2854")

#export coral species percent
write.csv(coral_spp,"coral_spp.csv", row.names = FALSE)

#bleaching data
bleach_2016 <- read_csv(here("data", "bleaching_data", "bleaching_2016.csv")) %>% 
  clean_names()
bleach_adult_2019 <- read_csv(here("data", "bleaching_data", "adult_corals_exp_aug2019.csv"))
bleach_adult_2019_NS <- read_csv(here("data", "bleaching_data", "adult_corals_NS_oct2019.csv"))

#export coral bleaching data
write.csv(bleach_2016,"bleach_2016.csv", row.names = FALSE)


#fish data
fish <- read_csv(here("data", "fish_data", "annual_fish_survey.csv")) %>% 
  clean_names() %>% 
  select("year", "location", "taxonomy", "family", "count") %>% 
  mutate(count = as.numeric(count))

#export fish data
write.csv(fish,"fish.csv", row.names = FALSE)

counts <- fish %>% 
  count(taxonomy, wt = count)

#export fish counts
write.csv(counts,"fish_counts.csv", row.names = FALSE)

```
